summary: Build a "Tyagi Chef" hospitality management app to manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients.
architectural_notes: Ensure Job Opening stores a clientId reference to a Client (and expose it via CRUD APIs) so a Job Opening can be linked to a Client.
Extend Client data model/API to store staffing requirements (e.g., list of roles/positions needed, quantity, notes) and expose via Client CRUD and UI forms/detail views.
known_issues: UI error: <Select.Item /> has an empty-string value prop; Select uses empty string to clear selection and show placeholder, so items must have non-empty values.
New Candidate flow runtime error: "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'toUpperCase')" occurs when creating a candidate (likely due to calling toUpperCase on an undefined field).

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity login and a basic role model for access control (at minimum: Admin and Staff) so authenticated users can manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients.
Build a React UI with navigation for Jobs, Candidates, Interviews, and Clients, each with: list view (search + filters), create form, edit form, and detail view.

Add a dashboard home screen that summarizes key counts (e.g., Open Jobs, New Candidates, Interviews Scheduled Today/This Week, Active Clients) and provides quick links to create a new Job, Candidate, Interview, and Client.

Implement consistent, creative visual theme and layout for the app (typography, spacing, components, and color palette) suitable for a professional hospitality staffing tool; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.

Add static generated brand assets and wire them into the UI (app icon/favicon + login/empty-state illustration) by placing files under frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.

Remove all <SelectItem value="">…</SelectItem> usages and replace them with a non-empty sentinel value (e.g., "__none__") for optional selects (Job Client, Candidate Linked Job, Interview Job Opening) while preserving the ability to clear the selection and show the placeholder by setting the Select value to an empty string.

Update the optional-select implementations in these pages to use the sentinel "None" option and map it to clearing the selection (empty string) in component state: frontend/src/pages/candidates/CandidateCreatePage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/candidates/CandidateEditPage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/interviews/InterviewCreatePage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/interviews/InterviewEditPage.tsx (jobOpeningId), frontend/src/pages/jobs/JobCreatePage.tsx (clientId), frontend/src/pages/jobs/JobEditPage.tsx (clientId).
Ensure a Job Opening can be linked to a Client and that the association is persisted and editable end-to-end (frontend forms -> backend -> detail views).
Add cross-navigation between Clients and Job Openings where a link exists.
Show Job Openings related to a Client on the Client detail page.
Add a new "Client staffing requirements" data field that lets users record which staff roles/positions a client needs, and persist it end-to-end (backend storage + create/update + read).
Update the Clients UI to allow managing client staffing requirements on Create and Edit pages, and display them on the Client Detail page using clear English labels and validation.

Update frontend React Query hooks and generated backend type usage so client create/update/query flows include the staffing requirements field and continue to invalidate/refetch client queries correctly.

Identify and fix the runtime UI error caused by using an empty-string value prop on shadcn <SelectItem /> ("<Select.Item /> has an empty-string value prop"), by removing/replacing any remaining <SelectItem value="">…</SelectItem> usages across the frontend and ensuring optional Selects use a non-empty sentinel option (e.g., '__none__') that maps to an empty string in component state to clear the selection.

Fix the New Candidate flow runtime crash "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'toUpperCase')" by making candidate status label/badge rendering resilient to missing or unexpected status values (e.g., undefined) in all candidate UI surfaces that call `toUpperCase()` (at minimum: Candidates list and Candidate detail pages).

Verify end-to-end that the backend always returns a populated `status` for `Candidate` records created via `createCandidate`, and if any data inconsistencies can still surface in the frontend (e.g., legacy records or decoding edge cases), ensure the frontend gracefully handles them without runtime errors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create hospitality management app for Tyagi Chef to manage job openings, candidates, interviews, and clients

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Job Openings, including: title/role, client association (optional), location, salary/rate (optional), description/requirements, status (Open/Paused/Closed), createdAt/updatedAt.

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Candidates, including: full name, phone/email, skills/notes, source, status (New/Screening/Interviewing/Offered/Placed/Rejected), and optional linkage to a Job Opening they are being considered for.

Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Interviews, including: candidate, job opening (optional if derived from candidate link), interview date/time, interview type (Phone/Video/In-person), interviewer name, location/meeting link, status (Scheduled/Completed/No-show/Cancelled), and outcome notes.
Create backend data models and CRUD APIs for Clients, including: company name, contact person, phone/email, address (optional), notes, and status (Active/Inactive).
Link Clients to Job Openings (associate a Job Opening with a Client, including UI selection and backend relationship).
Add ability to record which staff roles/positions a Client needs (client staffing requirements), including UI and backend fields.
